block.p: Suzanne Beth Fromer, a daughter of Barbara and Daniel Fromer of New Market, Md., was married yesterday evening to Andrew Cooper Hyman, a son of Sandra Hyman and Dr. George F. Hyman of Great Neck, N.Y. Rabbi Albert Sturmer officiated at the Cranwell Resort in Lenox, Mass.
The couple graduated from Dartmouth College, the bride summa cum laude, and received M.F.A. degrees in film production from the University of Southern California.

Suzanne Beth Fromer, a daughter of Barbara and Daniel Fromer of New Market, Md., was married yesterday evening to Andrew Cooper Hyman, a son of Sandra Hyman and Dr. George F. Hyman of Great Neck, N.Y. Rabbi Albert Sturmer officiated at the Cranwell Resort in Lenox, Mass.
The couple graduated from Dartmouth College, the bride summa cum laude, and received M.F.A. degrees in film production from the University of Southern California.

The bride, who is keeping her name, was until last month an assistant at the Creative Artists Agency in Los Angeles. The bridegroom is a story editor at Created By, a literary management and film production company in Los Angeles. The couple have also written, directed and produced short films.

The bride's father, who retired as an industrial arts teacher at Martin Luther King Junior High School in Germantown, Md., restores antique furniture. Her mother is the vice principal at Clear Spring Middle School in Clear Spring, Md.

The bridegroom's mother is a board member of the Great Neck Student Aid Fund. His father is an ophthalmologist in Brooklyn, where he is also the chairman of the ophthalmology department at Brookdale University Hospital and Medical Center and an assistant professor at the State University Health Science Center.
